channel.title: Dropdown Menu shows up behind my DIV containing images! HELP!
channel.description:
Hey guys, the website is http://favoritememoriesphotography.freehostia.com
I have the drop down menu created using some program named AllWebMenu.
Go to my sites main page and hover over the Photo Gallery link at the top. The menu shows up behind the image slideshow. I've tried to fix this for about 2 hours but just cannot figure it out. Any help greatly appreciated.
[size=8pt]P.S. This is still that site I'm making for one of my teachers. I'm making it for free so she agreed to let me put my adsense on it. Give me some clicks if you would like[/size] :D :D :D

item.source: Dropdown Menu shows up behind my DIV containing images! HELP!

item.title: Dropdown Menu shows up behind my DIV containing images! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“mjordan, post:6, topic:304774”][quote author=Starting up … link=topic=401053.msg2973632#msg2973632 date=1254093411]

Your special?
[/quote]Haha no I was a peer buddy for the special kids. And she’s a good friend of my girlfriends mom.

And yes I have fixed it now, just played around with the stylesheet position: absolute; and z-index and eventually got it to work.

Now, any suggestions for the site? It’s not done yet, gonna put a slideshow up on the contact page and about page then it’s pretty much done.

Now another problem… View one of the picture galleries in IE and see how there’s that big empty space on the right? Then in firefox it doesn’t have that problem. How can I get rid of that space?[/quote]Looks fine to me (IE 7)

Read full topic
item.source: Dropdown Menu shows up behind my DIV containing images! HELP!

item.title: Dropdown Menu shows up behind my DIV containing images! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

[quote=“Starting up …, post:5, topic:304774”]Your special?[/quote]Haha no I was a peer buddy for the special kids. And she’s a good friend of my girlfriends mom.

And yes I have fixed it now, just played around with the stylesheet position: absolute; and z-index and eventually got it to work.

Now, any suggestions for the site? It’s not done yet, gonna put a slideshow up on the contact page and about page then it’s pretty much done.

Now another problem… View one of the picture galleries in IE and see how there’s that big empty space on the right? Then in firefox it doesn’t have that problem. How can I get rid of that space?

Read full topic
item.source: Dropdown Menu shows up behind my DIV containing images! HELP!

item.title: Dropdown Menu shows up behind my DIV containing images! HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

Works fine for me…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 27, 2009, 05:19:17 pm[/size][hr][quote=“mjordan, post:4, topic:304774”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=401053.msg2973029#msg2973029 date=1254075326]
Man that is nasty, I’d check out something like this: http://designreviver.com/tutorials/jquery-css-example-dropdown-menu/
[/quote]Hmm, that link didn’t seem to provide any info than creating a basic dropdown. I’d rather stay with my javascript menu, but might have to resort to something like that explained.

Try editing the zindex maybe?

Lol?

[code]

[/code]

Yes I tried the z-index but couldn’t figure it out lol. I googled all that shit and after 2 hours of nothing working, I just couldn’t figure out what to do or if I was doing it right.
And yeah the teacher wanted people to not be able to right click, don’t ask lol.[/quote]

Holli Grubb Knoxville, TN, United States My name is Holli Grubb and I live in Knoxville, TN. I have been a Special Education teacher for eleven years now. I have coached Special Olympics and girls basketball. I married a wonderful man named Jim on July 12, 2006. He is also working with me on this photography adventure. I am currently a Creative Memories Consultant and I love taking pictures. I love capturing precious moments of peoples lives. My best subjects to shoot pictures of are my niece and nephew.

Your special?

Read full topic

[quote=“Unhandled, post:3, topic:304774”]Man that is nasty, I’d check out something like this: http://designreviver.com/tutorials/jquery-css-example-dropdown-menu/[/quote]Hmm, that link didn’t seem to provide any info than creating a basic dropdown. I’d rather stay with my javascript menu, but might have to resort to something like that explained.

[quote=“cumescape, post:2, topic:304774”]Try editing the zindex maybe?

Lol?

[code]

[/code][/quote]

Yes I tried the z-index but couldn’t figure it out lol. I googled all that shit and after 2 hours of nothing working, I just couldn’t figure out what to do or if I was doing it right.
And yeah the teacher wanted people to not be able to right click, don’t ask lol.
